content.description:
A new(ish) route just right of

Death On The Nile

.  Two bolts gets you up the first half on a series of smallish holds.  From the shelf you can either go left and finish on

Death On The Nile

, or go right to the Deceptive part of

Deceptive Corner

.
content.protection: Two bolts for the first half plus a couple of pieces for the top and anchor.
content.location:
In between

Death On The Nile

and

Deceptive Corner

climbs.name: Ocean of Night (aka Out to Grunge)

content.description: Start on a pumpy flake moving on to a nice resting ledge. The top half of the climb is a scary move over the crux to the single bolt followed by a thin finger crack to the finish.

Begin just right of Deceptive Corner. Climb up to an intermittent vertical crack (5.7), then move slightly right and climb up to a slightly overhanging section with 2 bolts. Powerful moves (crux, 5.12-) lead up to a horizontal crack (2-inch CD here), then move right and up a slim right-facing corner past another bolt (11a) to the top.

An alternate start (10a) is a few feet right- up to the bolt on Little Moe, then up and left to the headwall.

climbs.name: Little Moe
climbs.fa: John Long and Bob Gaines, March 1993.

content.description: Begin a few feet right of Moetown and climb a juggy face past a bolt  (10a) up to a horizontal crack. Just above this a bolt protects a few stout pulls on slightly overhanging rock (11a).
content.protection: 4 to 5 inch CDs for anchor on top.

content.description: Start up Curly to the horizontal break. Work left about 10 feet and clip a high bolt. Follow hollow and grainy flakes up the wall. Mostly positive holds with a few long reaches.
content.location: Right of Big Moe, sharing the start with Larry and breaking left along the horizontal.

climbs.name: Ground Up or Shut Up (aka Poppycock)
climbs.fa: (TR) Bob Gaines & Scott Cosgrove, January 1994, FL: Al Swanson

content.description: A surprisingly cool route with good moves in the upper and lower sections.  High crux on good rock.  Very cool movement and a safe climb.  Should get more traffic...
content.protection: 6 draws, two bolts on top for toprope
content.location:
Just left of

Boulder Dash

. Six obvious bolts will help identify the route.

climbs.name: Fat Tuesday
climbs.fa: Bob Gaines and Patty Kline, May 2002

content.description: Start from the big ledge about 30 feet off the ground, just left of Ocean of Night. Same start as Bucket Brigade, but immediately climb straight up to reach a right-slanting thin crack (thin pro) that leads to a slightly overhanging face and mantle (crux), finishing 10 feet left of Big Easy.
content.protection: To 3 inches, including some thin nuts and CDs.
content.location: Between Bucket Brigade and Big Easy.

content.description: Start about thirty feet to the right of Death on the Nile (5.10a). Climb the left slanting crack to a ledge. You can belay here if you wish. Surmount the corner, and climb to the top. I've always found the crux to be the move at the top.

climbs.name: Death On The Nile
climbs.fa: A. Bartlett, M. Lechlinski, M. Gingery, D. Evans, T. Atherton, T. Gordon 5/88

content.description: This route is between "Ocean of Night" and "Deceptive Corner". Climb to the bolt then swing out left and straight up. I've led this route twice, and it's a kick in the butt. It's tricky to place pro and somewhat runout. So,if you like a bit of a thrill, go for it.

Fun little route a bit right of Big Moe, with the climbing being similar in nature to its popular neighbor.  Crux is moving left and setting up for a massive jug before the horizontal.  Pumpy movement through the top half isn't as obvious but the sequence goes via generally positive holds.
content.protection: Bolts with seperate belay/TR bolts for both variations.

content.description: This route starts on the ledges to the left of "Ocean of Night". Climb the buckets then up the left leaning crack. Be aggressive at the start.

As you walk into Echo Cove from the parking lot, this climb lies on the steep dark face on your right. It is easily recognized by the large, brown, right-facing dihedral high on the rock.

The original (and best protected) line starts just left of Big Moe, then takes cracks/ramp up and left (5.7) to the base of the dihedral. The dihedral is fun laybacking and stemming (5.9) with good pro.

More direct (and difficult; 5.10 to 5.11) starts can be done to the left, though they are not well protected.
content.protection: Small to 2.5 inch cams. The various direct starts do not have good pro, though some exists. The upper dihedral has excellent pro. Larger cams usefull for belay or to top-rope.

climbs.name: Big Moe
climbs.fa: (TR) John Bachar, Mike Lechlinski, Mari Gingery, 1980.

content.description:
This excellent route is located on your right (south) as you walk into the Cove from the parking area. It takes a fairly direct line about 25 feet right of the large right-facing dihedral on the upper portion of the wall (

Boulder Dash

, 5.9*).

The climb name is "short" for big dynamo or "mo", the technique used by the first ascent party to solve the crux move down low. Though this move is now commonly done statically, shorter people often "pop" for the huge hand hold.

Great climbing from bottom to top on excellent rock.
content.protection:
If you chose to lead this route (you have to do the crux without pro); bring cams 1 to 2 inches for the two horizontals. Though given an "R" rating, it probably is best given an R/X rating as any fall at the crux would be very bad and if you landed wrong....

Most people top-rope this climb (2 bolt anchor on top). The route is rarely lead, but often free soloed.

climbs.name: Big Easy
climbs.fa: Bob Gaines and Patty Kline, October 1999

content.description: Start from the big ledge about 30 feet off the ground, just left of Ocean of Night. Climb the face about 10 feet right of Bucket Brigade, on slightly overhanging jugs, then move up and right on a lower-angled face to a headwall with a slightly overhanging left slanting crack (with a fixed pin) to finish.
content.protection: Thin to 3 inches, plus 3-4 inches (2 x #4 camalots) for the anchor (well back from the edge), or you can set up a TR anchor just below the edge (.5 to 1.5 inches).
content.location: Left of Ocean of Night and right of Fat Tuesday/Bucket Brigade.
